item.title: 贝森特将就美国经济政策在众议院小组委员会作证
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特摄影师：埃里克·李/彭博社【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent Photographer: Eric Lee/Bloomberg】

item.title: 亿万富翁伊什比亚为新工业基金筹集4亿美元
item.description: 由亿万富翁贾斯汀·伊什比亚创立的芝加哥私募股权公司Shore Capital Partners，已为其第二只工业基金筹集逾4亿美元资金。【原文：Shore Capital Partners, a Chicago-based private equity firm founded by billionaire Justin Ishbia, has raised more than $400 million for its second industrial fund.】

item.title: Adobe将广告支出增至14亿美元以应对人工智能引发的担忧
item.description: 面对激烈的市场竞争以及华尔街对其在人工智能时代沦为失败者的质疑，Adobe公司于2025年大幅增加广告投入，斥资14亿美元推广品牌。【原文：Adobe Inc. ramped up its advertising in 2025, spending $1.4 billion to promote its brand in the face of steep competition and skepticism from Wall Street that the company is a loser in the age of AI.】

item.title: 亚马逊在美国为Prime会员推出人工智能增强版Alexa
item.description: 亚马逊公司正在美国推出升级版Alexa，为付费Prime会员提供增强型人工智能数字助理服务，同时面向其他用户推出免费版本。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is taking the wrapper off its upgraded Alexa in the US, offering the AI-enhanced digital assistant to paying Prime customers and introducing a free version for everyone else.】

item.title: 波兰央行再度按兵不动，经济加速增长
item.description: 波兰央行维持利率不变，在经济增长意外强劲后，连续第二个月暂停宽松周期。【原文：Poland’s central bank kept interest rates steady, pausing its easing cycle for a second month, after unexpectedly strong economic growth.】

item.title: 美国坚持发行短期国债，未来数个季度不会提高中期票据和债券发行量
item.description: 美国财政部在债务发行策略上未作重大调整，符合交易商预期。此前市场曾猜测官员们可能采取措施降低长期借贷成本。【原文：The US Treasury refrained from any major shift in its debt-issuance strategy, meeting dealers’ expectations in the face of speculation that officials might take steps to bring down longer-term borrowing costs.】

item.title: 科技巨头在美国电力账单上的承诺仍存诸多疑问
item.description: 像OpenAI这样的公司，其承诺的落实缺乏明确的机制保障。【原文：There’s no clear mechanism for a company like OpenAI to follow through on its commitments.】

item.title: 美国企业1月新增2.2万个就业岗位，ADP报告称
item.description: 美国企业1月份新增就业岗位数低于预期，表明年初劳动力市场持续放缓。【原文：US companies added fewer jobs than expected in January, pointing to a continued slowdown in the labor market at the start of the year.】

item.title: 华尔街经纪商Clear Street寻求10.5亿美元IPO融资
item.description: 基于云计算技术建立的华尔街经纪公司Clear Street Group Inc.计划通过首次公开募股筹集高达10.5亿美元资金。【原文：Clear Street Group Inc., a Wall Street broker built on cloud computing technology, is looking to raise as much as $1.05 billion in an initial public offering.】

item.title: Resolve AI凭借其防范系统中断的人工智能代理，估值突破10亿美元
item.description: Resolve AI是一家致力于开发人工智能代理以发现并修复实时软件系统问题的初创公司，在最新融资轮中估值已达10亿美元。【原文：Resolve AI, a startup building AI agents to find and fix problems in live software systems, just hit a $1 billion valuation in a new funding round.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州牧场主担忧食肉害虫卷土重来
item.description: 克里斯·沃马克是德克萨斯州为数不多的牧场主之一，他亲历过与新世界螺虫的斗争。这种曾被消灭的害虫在重返墨西哥北部后，正威胁着在美国卷土重来。【原文：Chris Womack is one of a dwindling number of Texas ranchers who can remember fighting the New World screwworm, a once-vanquished pest threatening to make an unwanted encore in the US after its recent return to northern Mexico.】

item.title: 江森自控预测十年最强劲利润增长
item.description: 江森自控国际公司季度订单强劲增长后，其经调整每股收益增速创十年新高。【原文：Johnson Controls International Plc sees its adjusted earnings per share rising at the fastest pace in a decade after strong quarterly order growth.】

item.title: 德州仪器斥资75亿美元收购Silicon Labs
item.description: 德州仪器公司已达成协议，将以75亿美元收购美国芯片企业硅实验室公司，此举将深化其在多个传统芯片市场的布局，包括家电、电力、工业及医疗设备领域。【原文：Texas Instruments Inc. has reached an agreement to buy the US chip firm Silicon Laboratories Inc. in a deal valued at $7.5 billion, deepening its exposure to several long-standing markets for chips including the home appliance, power, industrial and medical-device sectors.】

item.title: 智利央行称利率应降至4.25%，因风险减弱
item.description: 智利央行表示，其基准利率应降至预估中性区间的中点4.25%，并在1月政策会议上审议了降息事宜，会议纪要显示。【原文：Chile’s central bank said its benchmark interest rate should fall to the 4.25% midpoint of its estimated neutral range and weighed a cut at its January policy decision, according to the minutes to that meeting.】

item.title: 美国收益率曲线逼近四年最大幅度，市场聚焦债券拍卖
item.description: 美国收益率曲线的关键部分已逼近四年来的最陡峭水平，投资者正密切关注美国财政部周三晚些时候公布的季度债券发行计划，以期从中获取未来政府债券发行的线索。【原文：A key part of the US yield curve is near its steepest level in four years as investors look to the Treasury’s quarterly bond sale plans later Wednesday for clues on future government issuance.】

item.title: 埃及为加强网络安全采取行动，拟禁止Roblox游戏平台
item.description: 埃及监管机构采取行动禁止Roblox公司的游戏平台，这个中东人口最多的国家表示正致力于限制儿童接触潜在有害的网络内容。【原文：Egyptian regulators moved to ban Roblox Corp.’s gaming platform, as the Middle East’s most populous nation says it’s making a push to curb childrens’ exposure to potentially harmful online material.】

item.title: 优步将在香港、马德里、休斯顿和苏黎世推出无人驾驶出租车服务
item.description: 优步科技公司将把无人驾驶出租车服务扩展至香港和马德里，这家网约车巨头正向新兴行业投入数亿美元资金。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. will expand its robotaxi services to include Hong Kong and Madrid as the ride-hailing giant pours hundreds of millions of dollars into the emerging industry.】

item.title: 微软与OpenAI的交易如今被视为风险而非回报
item.description: 这段曾备受赞誉的伙伴关系，如今却面临着怀疑的观众。【原文：The partnership, once applauded, now faces a skeptical audience】

item.title: 人工智能芯片初创企业Positron从Arm和卡塔尔获得2.3亿美元融资，将与英伟达展开竞争
item.description:
本轮融资使这家志在挑战英伟达的公司估值超过10亿美元

【原文：

The round values the aspiring Nvidia rival at more than $1 billion

】

item.title: 主要经济体争相采购稀土以实现供应多元化，摆脱对中国依赖
item.description: 华盛顿将于周三召集数十个国家商讨制定计划【原文：Washington is convening dozens of nations Wednesday to hammer out plans】

item.title: 为何美国人负担能力焦虑终究归结于住房问题
item.description: 特朗普政府曾辩称，美国家庭生活日益改善，因为其收入增长速度超过了消费价格涨幅。但选民们始终不买这个账。【原文：Donald Trump’s administration, has argued that American households are increasingly better off because their incomes are growing faster than consumer prices. But voters keep on rejecting that argument.】

item.title: 纳斯达克考虑推出新"快速上市"规则，为SpaceX等大型IPO铺路
item.description: 纳斯达克100指数的持有者提议加快将新上市的大型企业纳入该广受关注的股票基准指数，因今年将有大批科技巨头计划上市。【原文：The owner of the Nasdaq 100 Index is proposing to speed up the inclusion of newly listed, large-cap firms in the widely followed equity benchmark as a flurry of technology giants are slated to go public this year.】

item.title: 康纳·特斯基被任命为布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司首席执行官
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司任命康纳·特斯基为首席执行官，结束了布鲁斯·弗拉特在该资产管理公司掌舵的时代。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management named Connor Teskey chief executive officer, ending Bruce Flatt’s reign atop the asset manager.】

item.title: 优步盈利预期未达预期，任命新首席财务官布局无人驾驶出租车未来
item.description: 优步科技公司发布了疲软的盈利预期，并提拔了一位直言不讳的无人驾驶汽车乐观主义者担任新任首席财务官，这表明该公司将进一步投资于其备受关注的网约车业务领域。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. gave a weak profit outlook and promoted an outspoken driverless-vehicle bull to be its new chief financial officer, signaling further investment in a closely watched area of the ride-hailing company’s business.】

item.title: 非洲进出口银行同意为南非提供110亿美元贷款方案
item.description: 非洲进出口银行同意向南非提供110亿美元初始贷款，以缓解融资压力，支持基础设施项目和黑人企业。【原文：The African Export-Import Bank agreed to lend South Africa an initial $11 billion to ease funding pressures, support infrastructure projects and Black-owned businesses.】

item.title: 人工智能焦虑助推价值股强势回归
item.description:
软件股的抛售正提升价值股的吸引力。 

【原文：

The software selloff is boosting the appeal of value stocks. 

】

item.title: 投资者将资产从美国转移至欧洲，欧洲清算所首席执行官如是说
item.description: 据欧洲清算银行首席执行官瓦莱丽·厄尔班称，投资者正将资金日益转向欧洲资产，以分散对美国的投资风险，此举是对特朗普总统引发的市场动荡作出的反应。【原文：Investors are increasingly moving funds into European assets, diversifying away from the US in a reaction to the market turbulence created by President Donald Trump, according to Euroclear Chief Executive Officer Valerie Urbain.】

item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet的财报表现需支撑其股价2万亿美元的上涨行情
item.description: 字母表公司正迅速成为人工智能行业几乎所有主要领域的领军者。周三盘后公布的财报将验证这一声誉是否名副其实——以及是否足以继续推高股价。【原文：Alphabet Inc. is rapidly becoming seen as the leader in almost every major part of the artificial intelligence industry. Its earnings after the close Wednesday will help confirm whether that reputation is justified — and whether it’s enough to keep lifting shares.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行收购韦伯斯特银行，标志着安娜·博廷的并购攻势告一段落
item.description: 安娜·博廷从未掩饰过她将桑坦德银行打造成美国领先银行的雄心。周二，她表示将斥资120亿美元实现这一目标。【原文：Ana Botin has never hidden her ambition to build Banco Santander SA into a leading US bank. On Tuesday, she said she’ll spend $12 billion to get there.】

item.title: 沃什将需要他引以为傲的交际能力，才能顺利重返美联储——这个机构曾对他不屑一顾。
item.description: 2002年夏天，32岁的凯文·沃什发现自己卷入了一场围绕当时最复杂金融立法的政治斗争。【原文：In the summer of 2002, 32-year-old Kevin Warsh found himself at the center of a political fight over some of the era’s most complex financial legislation.】
